repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

comment_data.body: just `"selected"` , pum is already the context.
could use `nvim_create_buf(false, true)` which sets up some of the things here.
add `config.style = kWinStyleMinimal`
"HIDDEN" is not something we use, so should be safe to remove?
similarly, `use_popup` would just be a bool.

could take `buf_T *buf` param and use `ml_append_buf()` etc functions. (we might not get to avoiding curbuf switching completely in first PR, but we could just as well prepare for it, and avoiding curbuf in new helper functions is good style)
before removed. but I see there has an issue for add popup_hide popup_show relate function ..so I think can be add and maybe we will use it in next pr.
yes.. before consider this..then I think it's safe because we are single thread..
do we need to enter window? Just displaying some text and setting a few basic options should be possible without entering.
did we do any changes to real curwin? I don't think redraw should be needed
in `pum_set_selected` need `win_enter` . in api level maybe no need enter. I can add a bool flag .
done.
there are modified by `make doc`
any good name of `preview_` prefix ? seems like a little long. doc format not looks good.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1373,6 +1373,8 @@ M.funcs = {
       		no item is selected when using the <Up> or
       		<Down> keys)
          inserted	Inserted string. [NOT IMPLEMENTED YET]
+         preview_winid     Info floating preview window id.

comment_data.body: `v:event["selected"] == 2` this makes the info apply to the third item (zero-indexed), though in the test we get to the first item only.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1790,6 +1790,36 @@ describe('builtin popupmenu', function()
       end)
     end
 
+    it('pum popup preview', function()
+      screen:set_default_attr_ids({})
+      screen:try_resize(30, 8)
+      exec([[
+        funct Omni_test(findstart, base)
+          if a:findstart
+            return col(".") - 1
+          endif
+          return [#{word: "one", info: "1info"}, #{word: "two", info: "2info"}, #{word: "three"}]
+        endfunc
+        set omnifunc=Omni_test
+        set completeopt=menu,popup
+        funct Set_info()
+          let comp_info = complete_info()
+          if has_key(comp_info, 'preview_bufnr')
+            call nvim_set_option_value('filetype', 'markdown', {'buf': comp_info['preview_bufnr']})
+          endif
+          if has_key(v:event, 'selected') && v:event["selected"] == 2

comment_data.body: It simulates asynchronously setting info after `feed<C-n>` twice. three is selected then.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
• 'completeopt' option supports "popup" flag to show extra information in
  floating window.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -189,6 +189,9 @@ The following new APIs and features were added.
 
 • Added |:fclose| command.
 
+• 'completeopt' option supports for "popup" flags for show extra information
+  in floating window.

comment_data.body: This include doesn't seem needed
Does `comp_info.selected` not work?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -1790,6 +1790,211 @@ describe('builtin popupmenu', function()
       end)
     end
 
+    describe("floating window preview #popup", function()
+      it('pum popup preview', function()
+        screen:try_resize(30, 11)
+        exec([[
+          funct Omni_test(findstart, base)
+            if a:findstart
+              return col(".") - 1
+            endif
+            return [#{word: "one", info: "1info"}, #{word: "two", info: "2info"}, #{word: "three"}]
+          endfunc
+          set omnifunc=Omni_test
+          set completeopt=menu,popup
+          funct Set_info()
+            let comp_info = complete_info()
+            if has_key(comp_info, 'preview_bufnr')
+              call nvim_set_option_value('filetype', 'markdown', {'buf': comp_info['preview_bufnr']})
+            endif
+            if has_key(v:event, 'selected') && v:event["selected"] == 2
+              call nvim_complete_set_info(v:event["selected"], "3info")
+            endif

comment_data.body: This doesn't work when `ext_popupmenu` is enabled (and may have a value from a previous popupmenu instead of the current one), while `complete_info().selected` does work, so I don't think this should be added.
correct. I didn't notice complete_info at the time. Found it later. So this is a duplicate
Is this needed? If old-curwin had changes it is expected to already redraw itself.
not sure. before removed also work. don't why bram add this. I guess we use a different way to show float window so I guess can remove.
redundant comment
just `wp->w_float_config.hide = false;` without if
it is fine as it is.

comment_data.body: `WINDOW_OBJ` and `BUFFER_OBJ` respectively

Hmm, using `pum_text` as the key is a little weird, but might be best for now as `comp` is a linked list. If it was an array, the index should be same as the index into `pum_array[i]`..  

perhaps could add a doc comment with a `TODO` like "TODO: If compl_first_match is refactored to be an array, this could take the index"
could add a `@return` annotation here for returning NULL when "no enough room to show"
yes. plan to use VirtText refactor there after completepopup done.
done.
I think we discussed this before, but for now this can just be single `bool`.  like `w_float_is_info` placed next to `w_floating` .

comment_data.body: yes. I forget there. because we don't have menu info confirm popupwindow. so use single `bool` is nice

comment_regular_data.body: When this merges I think we should make it default instead of `menu,preview` - `preview` is unintuitive and a bit annoying, slightly less so when using an autocmd to autoclose the preview window on certain events.
Is there a reason this isn't controlled by `completeopt=popup` like Vim? If so, can you explain that in the commit message and PR description.

> Is there a reason this isn't controlled by completeopt=popup like Vim?

hmm ? it use `popup` same as vim Keep option values compatible
My mistake. I saw what looked like a new API function, and ctrl-f "completeopt" didn't find anything, so I wanted to be sure. But now I see the changes to `src/nvim/optionstr.c`.

title: feat(ui): completeopt support popup like vim
